hRjmtFnmek65JkLryEfj2w.text: I really don't like it here. It's everything that's wrong with the new spitalfieds. Although somehow it still have queues coming out of it at the weekends. The annoying thing is, it's hard to moan baout becuase they don't do anything wrong. Well, they did serve me a glass of shit wine once, but I was hungover and i imagine my taste was somewhat impaired. It's not their fault that I don't like brown rice, but it did ruin my stir fry. To be honest, once we got here, i wanted to leave. i realised that while it may be a fun homely place during the day, full of a buzz and fun with the market on it doorstep, that all changes in the veening and it's a bit dull. I wish i'd had the balls to say let's go somewhere else or at least make a fake phone call. So we sat on uncomfy chairs, had an uncomfy meal and then left. Giraffe: not very comfy.

b5uS89THfqeX6BgMxKYenQ.text: I really do think that this is one of the best restaurant chains in London right now, and that this one, right in the heart of Spitalfields Market is one of the leading for the chain. The service is always top notch, and they are happy to discuss with you various dishes on the menu to help make your selection. Being just that bit away from the city, and on the fringes, make this not full of city workers, but full of the sort of mix of people who would visit the market, so it is an interesting place to be - especially the people watching! The menu is extensive, and much of it healthy, although their world famous burgers are amazing too! Definately give it is try if you are in the area.

PSwQ7rDQ8AIc1MxQuX20ag.text: Dinner there with few friends, they have 50% off from Mon to Thurs after 7pm, so it was definitely worth! Food yummy as usual, the only downside I can think of is the wine, not as tasty as the food, but overall is a good place to go with a group of friends.

w4SrnnEoaqs_1UVFQnaG3Q.text: Apparently worthy (plenty of veg. and pulses), and worldly (ethnic and international styles), the diner is in fact presented with an overpriced and under-appetising meal.

3Hq-TKjKWa7R_x7Wmj4rjQ.text: Good for vegetarian breakfasts - with sausages as well. I personally don't like this kind of service. They are friendly when they are taking orders but they come and ask you too many questions afterwards. Too many people checking if you are enjoying your meal.

53V2c_vRDwSwv570ElbozA.text: I've been to Giraffe a couple of times and after each one I've vowed never to return!  It wasn't so much the number of kids underfoot, or the serious lack of interest from the waiters (I asked at least 4 times for a glass of water before giving up and pulling out my water bottle from my bag!).  The main reason for my dislike of Giraffe is the food itself.  I ordered a smoothie (which actually was pretty good) and a salad.  Having spent the day traipsing around the shops with a friend I was famished and the idea of a "sunshine powerfood salad" (spicy roasted pumpkin, spinach, edamame beans, cashew nuts, mixed leaves etc) was actually making me quite excited.  When my meal finally arrived it was disappointingly small, barely enough for a starter size. And at £6.95 I was tempted to take it back.  Washed down with my blueberry bliss smoothie, it almost filled a hole & I didn't complain, but once again promised myself that this was the final time I graced Giraffe with my presence.

dUjXGg83yz1GBBSmHOnOiA.text: We had luncn there today and both chose the Falafel Burger which was nicely presented with rocket salad and harissa and chips or green salad. The burger was with us in around 10 mins considering it was lunch time that was quick. The service was snappy and freindly! The food was really nice served ina seeded bun with beetroot relish and mayo adding some nice flavours. The waitress recommended the Cheescake. which is about the best cheesecake that ive ever tasted. Lovely buttery base I will defo be going back

kV6R2DfmupN6ChZBJV_cfw.text: they have good burgers. its quite expensive when you are on a student budget but there are things on the menu that are affordable. its not that expensive but some of us are not fortunate to have said budget. but everytime i have eatten here i didnt have a complaint.

Q-f1YRYqo8kpycTHcPDAhg.text: Giraffe are a family friendly chain of relaxed style restaurants. The branch in Spitafields is my favourite. It's a decent size and the windows on two sides of the restaurant means that you can watch the hustle and bustle of the area whilst you enjoy your nosh. And what nosh it is! The portions are huge - especialy the burgers, and even if you have a large appetite I recommend leaving some space for the divine desserts - sometimes I only come here for pudding! The staff are friendly, the service is quick and if you are bringing children this place is perfect. They offer a very good children's menu as well are colouring-in mats and crayons to keep the little one's entertained (sometimes baloons are also given at the end of the meal). One of my favourite restaurants for a relaxed meal with friends.

t38ZIHqi78GrmJcAgbDurQ.text: My experience differs massively from the review above. I had a terrible time in this place. Waiting 45 mins for food was not good, and we were told we are busy, so you have to expect to wait. It was only about 50% full too. The food, when it arrived, was good. But definitely NOT huge. The quality was there, but I was disappointed with the size of portions. One plus point was the smoothies, but at £3.50 a pop they should be good! Maybe it is better for families, but I was not impressed.

KCOZLNsLVHbY26iucu-RSQ.text: This is exactly the same menu as all the other Giraffes, so it just depends if you like that sort of thing. The branch gets crazy busy at lunchtime, but the staff are pretty good about sitting you as quickly as possible. If you're alone, it's nice to sit at the bar stools in the window and have your lunch - there's definitely enough options for people watching!

4nNXptDMiORgr96m2TK14g.text: It is a part of a chain of restaurants in UK. I dropped into the one at Liverpool Street. Nicely settled in a corner, right opposite the Liverpool market, the restaurant on a Sunday afternoon has a family buzz. The food is nothing to brag about but the beverages are definitely worth a try. Especially recommended are Vanilla latte and hot chocolate with marshmallows!

U9EY96tArcnC513DHuuLEQ.text: Came here one Saturday visiting Spitalfields for the first time as part of my weeklong trip with my husband to London last summer.  This is one of those things where I have to try brunch in a local place.  I usually try to stay away from chains even when I am in a foreign country but I saw decent reviews for this place and was the only place I can find that is affordable with the limited knowledge that I have of London.Because this is such a late review, I can't remember what me and my husband had so I'm going to guess I had the Full Brunch Plate.  The one thing that really stuck out for me about the dish is the sausage.  It was very very delicious.Price-wise I think is pretty reasonable for brunch.  I live in the East coast of the United States and the value is about the same, albeit a bit more expensive in London but this is expected.

k--TVl-PmhL04dU-WsnqOA.text: Giraffe is clean, healthy, fresh, unique and wonderful food!There is a ton of food to choose from on the menu jam-packed with flavor!I went for brunch and got the huevos rancheros and loved it!It is a must try place!

cYoEAmjLCpQKWGrvn4n_Uw.text: Meal Deal! 9.95 for starter and main in the evening (after 5??). Giraffe was nearby this weekend's festival venue, so I went there one night for a food run. Giraffe was also the go-to spot for getting carry out order for starving instructors. A friend and I sat down to enjoy a meal amidst the chaos. I enjoy their hummus and flatbread along with the chicken and couscous. Their meal deal offers several options, so I went with Mediterranean stylings. You don't have to pick a region, but I've been enjoying kebabs all weekend, so it seemed fitting. The flatbread was great, the perfect scooping device for the tasty green hummus. I enjoyed the pickled items that with this dish also. The slightly spicy chicken's flavor was nicely offset with the couscous's slight sweetness. Great place for evening dining needs or carry out orders.

9-fu1pwttETnzF4BdmuPyA.text: Regular weekly haunt after work. Good atmosphere. Fair prices. Friendly staff. Nice food. Ran out of medium-praise adjectives. Bye.

jOz3xfQjIV04ZoCt0L9_DQ.text: My husband and I came in for an early dinner on a Wednesday night. It wasn't super crowded and we got seated right away. I love that this place carries the Rekorderlig Strawberry & Lime Cider!  We got the Chicken Potstickers and the Grilled Yakitori Chicken Skewers for starters. These were both a nice small manageable starter size. The potstickers were crispy and flavorful and came with two tasty dipping sauces. The chicken skewers I got the Parmesan Chicken Schnitzel "Kiev". It wasn't exactly what I expected, but I guess I wasn't exactly sure what to expect. Either way, it was tasty but not phenomenal. My hubby had the Tequila & Lime Chicken Breast. He said it was good but nothing spectacular.

Ha4D7m60Kl4HZk-cPjA8BA.text: Went to Giraffe for dinner in the week, ealry-ish, a couple of weeks ago. Had the set menu which was pretty cheap - something like a tenner for 2 decent courses and a glass of wine. Good points - the service was good - My curry was too spicy to eat so they replaced it with an alternative dish quite quickly and free of charge with no fuss. The price was good, and the noise, and music was just right. Bad points - the wine was a small glass which wasn't specified on the menu (I wans't in a drinking mood anyway though to be fair), and the chargrilled chicken we has was pretty dry and chewy but passable. It has a very kind of'clean, family, fun' atmosphere which isn't really my cup of tea but they seem to do what they do, well. Went again today for a lunch with colleagues. Again the set menu was reasonable and the food was hot and delicious. They seated us straight away even though it was busy and the service was good. I was going to go for the 'A-ok' 3 stars but the good service pushes it up to 4 for me. To keep it a good 4 or 5 stars they should push the cocktails and wine more in the evening, and the music could be better, it needs more of an edge, especially in Spitalfields, but I think thats just the brand. Wouldn't specifically go there again but if I ended up there I know I'd get good service.

8n2iXt3I8BcV7hjL0VtKQQ.text: OK this review comes after what was probably the worst visit out of the many times I visited this Giraffe. Never that impressed with the food, a large selection though and many options. The happy hour is pretty decent and Sunday night, a bottle of the house is always welcomed. This Giraffe closes at 23:00. So when I arrived at 22:10 and was seated I didn't expect to be so rushed. They said we had to order upon being seated because the kitchen wanted to close early. So luckily we knew what we wanted, but the cheesy bread that came out was burned, guess the kitchen was in a super rush. The rest of the food was as mediocre as possible. My friend's pasta which was supposed to have marscapone cheese, looked like sour cream was placed on instead and tasted like it. I will not be coming back.p.s. Lamb burger is usually a safe bet. Too much bun though at times.

_qxfZD6JpgEgLOc_9GXFsw.text: Great food, very international and not really expensive. Good point: after you order your meal, you are dished very fast !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

DUP9kX12snLTYqfwhIBT_g.text: I've always really liked Giraffe when I lived in London, and I knew quite a few people that liked it too (not just Americans, something else I've heard) so when I see reviews like this I just wonder why the people that do like Giraffe don't post 'cause I know they are plenty of them.We didn't mean to go to this location for my last visit, but we were having a hard time getting into dinner for other restaurants in the area and my friends said why try something new and wait a while when we knew that we liked Giraffe.We shared a few appetizers, the nachos nirvana was yummy and the mezze plate was full of flavor and had really warm naam.I got the Jambalaya Risoto which was very delicious!  Couldn't complain at all! Giraffe is a nice place, I always look forward to going to one when I'm back on this side of the pond!

X6bAea5LtSEKtfPTL6ZtFg.text: My mother and I stopped here for lunch on one of my rare trips to London to visit family, hoping for a tasty meal in a pleasant environment.The staff was very friendly, attentive and prompt. We were originally seated at a four seater table but were moved to a two seater table as we were looking at the menus - they weren't rude about it and they were very busy so no complaints! We also ended up with a table next to the window which was a bit quieter and altogether more agreeable! The whole place is reasonably attractive (and clean), and the bright decor and style reflects its "global" fusion food style.For drinks my mother ordered cranberry juice and I sparkling water. Both were very nice but a bit mean on the portion size - very small glasses!We had a sharing platter as a starter, with mixed olives, naan and focaccia bread, and hummus and baba ganoush to dip them in. The breads were nice though the focaccia was slightly burnt, the dips were so-so, but the mixed olives were lovely - and they had these delicious tiny onions in the mix with a depth of crunch and flavour that was delightful! If I visit again I'll stick with the olives instead.My mother had the Zuma Beach Salad for a main - I must confess I didn't try it but she reported that the dressing was not especially tasty (possibly a matter of taste) and that the salad over all was "all right" but she was most pleased that it had proper beetroot instead of the pickled stuff.I had the vegetable burrito and I was disappointed. The vegetables had been so thoroughly smothered in the sauce that you couldn't taste them, and the feta was inexplicably all in a stripe across the middle instead of scattered throughout. The best bit was the topping which had been saved from the dreaded sauce and was a combination of seeds and tomato chunks and was rather delicious. Overall it was a good dish made with (as far as I could tell) good ingredients spoiled by a heavy sauce that rendered it a bit tasteless. The side-salad it came with was tasty - good quality ingredients - but I couldn't have told you that the dressing was tequila and lime. It just tasted like a plain old caesar salad dressing, and a mild one at that.All in all, I'm not sure if I or my mother would want to return. Good idea, well-trained staff, whoever sauces the ingredients is excellent, but the recipes or the execution of them is flawed.

sV2z19cnAS-jpp2HNDN-Dw.text: I'm not a big fan of kids, ergo, family restaurants but have braved a trip to Giraffe to try out their simple, tempting menu in a fabulous location in the heart of Spitalfields Market.I tried the Mezze with Flat Bread which, at £6.95 could have been a little more exciting; with my friends' orders of chips and burgers looking much more appealing and necessitating a little covert pilfering.Surprisingly, perhaps for a well-known family haunt, Giraffe has a good selection of beers and ciders with the Savannah Dry Cider from South Africa at £3.50 a pop being particularly lush.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

3q4ntiGIFQ7PDEJrmpoc2Q.text: Lunch here was good enough, I guess. We were on a February walk through London, and this cafe looked interesting. I had seen other locations, so I guessed it was a local chain.

t6xuV8ptH4OqD4SjTl8SNA.text: I am not too keen on the whole idea of an international kitchen. To some, have an appetizers with Mediterranean flavour to be followed by a Thai main course and finished off by American dessert may be gorgeous. Not to me. I believe it diluted the personality of the restaurant. But giraffe do it well. Food is good. We had Thai noodles and I particularly like the selection of rare ingredients. I have to confess I dislike noodles since one day that I fell sick after tucking away at the noodles king, but these were significantly nicer. We also order the Greek burger, on a somewhat stale focaccia. Yet the thought of using focaccia for a burger is so awesome that it can be forgiven. In short, good food. Prices are average and service was efficient and obliging, which is what you get when you pay service charge.

PAfhoUtiLC4ucHehwJQtfQ.text: I don't mind this branch of the chain restaurant Giraffe.It's directly opposite the spitalfields market stalls, is completely under cover & has seating both within the restaurant & 'outside' where the markets are. I met with a friend for brunch here on a sunday morning. We sat outside, the waiter was attentive without being overbearing, prices seemed reasonable for the area & the breakfast menu had a good selection of choices on offer. All up we enjoyed eating here & it's a great choice as a meet up spot when going to the markets as it's right on the corner of the main entrance & easy to access.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

rnOdOKyPpxY0Nud6hB0utQ.text: Looking to end a relationship? Dump a friend? Treat your worst enemy? This would be your place.I am shocked that Giraff is still standing.  The first time I went here, their kitchen didn't work.  Their kitchen didn't work! No oven, no stove.  They could only serve three things on the menu. Although I was annoyed, I felt kinda bad and decided to come back.Well it turns out that even with a full functioning kitchen, you still need chefs.  And Giraff's kitchen is void of any culinary skill.  The food is processed, pre-packaged, and insulting.

7CuJDJU8_u6CWYS6a3lqIg.text: Setting - Good setting though quite cramped as the table's are close together but the lighting is nice and bright and big glass windows tooService - Friendly service and accommodating.Food - Very good burger with egg and cheese, chips were nice too. Worth the money paid and a place I intend to visit again very soon.Overall - I would go here again and have already recommended it to a number of people.

MiWxETFla89yTA5mtxEfEA.text: After a fail at getting into the breakfast club we continued on to the market and found solace in this really good place Food was good fresh fast tasty. Staff we quick and so pleasant coupled with a great setting its worth a visit.

5JdHpRzhrQ3ABBrrHRLqYg.text: I've been here once for lunch and doubt I will be back. The food was mediocre at best. The restaurant was loud, busy and there were a lot of kids running about. The vibe was that of a McDonald's but with nicer seating and table service. Utterly forgettable.

ToF9JdNepv7SU1LmC68EfQ.text: Had the vegetarian burrito. Solid choice when the menu isn't the best for vegetarians. Damn good.

8QQjfhPevN2kldx7wRpLiw.text: I've seen other branches of this restaurant around, but I finally decided to come here when I met up with another friend studying in London. The service wasn't as bad as everyone says it was, though we did have to wait a really long time before our waitress came over to take our orders. I ordered the £7.50 dinner special and got the garlic bread to start and the half Portugese chicken with mash as an entree. It seemed as though everything had been put together sloppily. The garlic bread was really good, but the cheese in the middle of three of the four pieces of bread was still solid, and the fourth piece was burnt. The chicken was mediocre. I got a fair amount of chicken, but the mashed potatoes were hard and dry with limp bits of cilantro mixed in, and the coleslaw (which was essentially mayo-covered onions) had been haphazardly dumped on top of my chicken. Coming from Los Angeles, where presentation is everything, this was kind of a turn off.It was a fairly pricey meal, and for what you get, I'd say it's not really worth it. I'd rather save the money for Nandos.

OIiuuUrkqkdBKlN3TmIpjQ.text: After a long day of walking and site-seeing I was so hungry I could have eaten a Giraffe. Just teasing! Unfortunately not many places were open. As I looked around I came across this unique spot. I went over the menu and there was such a huge variety of delicious sounding dishes I had a hard time deciding.I started with the Smokey Chorizo. Spanish style Chorizo cooked in a honey / sherry vinegar glaze. It was so tasty I could have eaten 3 more orders before my main course came out.Then I enjoyed the Thai Duck Stir-Fry. It was very delightful also. The duck was very tender.Add two hot coco's to warm me up and the Banana Waffle Split for dessert and I went back to my room far more content than I should have been.This is a great choice for 1 to 10 people. So many items and taste to choose from. You and everyone else will leave happy.

rA7GvJXbuj5t1V9lrNJaYg.text: During my visit, I had nachos, microwaved to the point corn chips wee burnt and black, extremely hot ! Steak was ok, slightly over cooked. Also, I don't believe very hygienic with what I saw. I won't be going back.

tGJj6d2GQHZWur1Q8lh_xQ.text: I sat in this place for 55 minutes waiting for a steak that never came. My friend who I sat with had to leave the food took so long to come. She took her food to go. My dinner never came They still charged me 20 pounds and reassured me that I was not charged for the steak that never came. G, thanks. Incompetence. Don't reward your business with it

ZQcs0W2sAR8bZUuz0YM-Qw.text: Food was okay, little pricey. Service was horrendously bad. Had to track down server (david) three time to have them wait on us. Then they automatically add a 12.5% gratitude on the bill with bad service. Shameful.

OnJZL_3LeYkLLt4gfs4IsQ.text: We were recommended this place by separate friends so we gave it a shot when we were in the area. Totally underwhelming both food and service. No draught beer. Malay curry was ok but wouldn't get again. Burger average (go to bleecker in the same building--20 times better).  Lamb tagine was probably the best dish we ordered and even that was 3.5/5. Cocktails were good not great and that's it. Avoid.

--QTO-64fIFciWtsExxpLw.text: We didn't have a great experience here. The food was okay but the service was pretty terrible.

E1SqXH3d87sbLuh7Ys_z3A.text: Actually quite disappointed with this Giraffe, have eaten at the one in Chiswick and it was very good.We got seated very quickly and ordered a couple of starters to share as we weren't super hungry, and a couple of the cocktails on happy hour.Cocktails: not too exciting and quite watered down, the mojito uses a sugar syrup instead of the traditional crushing the lime, mint and sugar together.Food: We ordered Halloumi skewers and Firecracker Chicken Tenders. They mixed up our order at first so it took a while for them to both come out but once they did the food was actually very nice. The Asian slaw that came with the Chicken Tenders wasn't very nice but the rest was delicious.  We then decided to order dessert. I got the Rocky Road Sundae which was decent and my friend got the apple and passion fruit crumble which was disappointing as the only passion-fruit involved was a little drizzle of passion-fruit syrup on top of the crumble. Service: They were a little bit too overzealous with asking if everything was okay more times than was necessary but when we actually wanted their attention they seemed to have blinders on.  Also three out of four of the female toilets were blocked and no one seemed to care. I spoke to a person at the beginning on the meal about it and I overheard someone else mention it at the end of the meal over an hour later!

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

FITbD_x6DWgcmOd_esqa4w.text: Busy loud atmosphere. Lemonade was too sweet. Food was average.. A bit overpriced. I ordered a starter and a side because I wasn't that hungry. Service was a bit slow.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Mezze and salad with lemonade. Presented quite nicely.

pd8xGAs83sbAhjldZXDBWg.text: Yes it's a chain. No I normally don't like chains. But this one gets 4 stars. Not only was our waiter amazing (Spanish guy, slightly older, super enthusiastic and lovely), but they have separate allergen menus, yey! Food was great, no complaints. Their cocktail happy hour is also good!!

facridxN6-NGTTYvhkX47w.text: I think it's worth at least trying the chains of the UK like Giraffe. Right? Helps me get to know the country and its tastes better. Well, Giraffe isn't the best of them.Came here with a group of 5 people for a mid-day lunch as a break from work. They were awfully slow considering they must get other customers like this - I'm glad I didn't have any pressing meetings to get to.I got a veggie version of an English Breakfast, which I've always kind of wanted to try. It was okay, but I wasn't too excited about it - it was lukewarm when I got it, not much flavor, except for the veggie sausages, which I'm pretty sure are the same pre-packaged brand I sometimes get from the grocery.The atmosphere was pretty nice though. Fun, optimistic, light-hearted. I'm glad I tried it, anyway.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Veggie Brunch - beans, avocado, poached eggs, toast, veggie sausage, and mushrooms.

0AAnWfoFsrPpVENgHrOk7Q.text: Moderately expensive items on the menu. You have a wide selection of beers and other drinks also. I loved the brunch menu which is excellent value for money. Moroccan mint tea is served in special metallic tea pots.If you are not a sweet food fan, avoid Phod Malay Noodles. Burgers here are also great value.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Moroccan mint tea

ztU2UTuXkaA0Qmdl1699aw.text: This chain of restaurant is ok if you don't know what you want to eat at least there is a taste of everything / every country. We had brunch  and dessert. I took the huevos rancheros. It's not the most excited think to eat but for the price and the area it's not bad at all. One of my friends had the veggie version of the brunch and the other one had the full English breakfast. No one complain about their food so that's a good sign. In term of dessert I had the banana split waffle. Nothing exciting but nice dessert I can say. My friends haLooking for a nice place to have a drink on Saturday night and we end up in Adventure Bar. That was a good spot! Even if the bat is busy they take the time to do some pretty nice cocktails! And if you decide not to drink the cocktail without alcohol are really cheap! (£3 my friend paid for a long and juicy cocktail fruit) the place is big and you can even book a table if you are a big group. The decoration is ok and what I like is that it did not smell like all these busy bars where you think you won't be able to stand there more than an hour! The music was not too bad and the bar women took every opportunity to dance with the crowd as soon as they could. Anyway nice place for a drink on a Saturday night! d the brownie, the chocolate mousse and the cheesecake. All were ok. Also this place is huge, so no need to queue and baby friendly so easy to come with a pram (which was the main reason why I end up there) So in conclusion if you don't know what to eat and in the same time you want a reasonable price and are not too difficult this place will easily do the job!

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Banana split waffle
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Huevos rancheros

nR0kcFUcn3xo7zYwDCr_xA.text: Drinks and entrees were tasty and good. Ordered a blackened salmon, didn't have much taste. Was with family who ordered burgers and they though they were good  very casual ambiance and good for families and groups.

rnPYaltQCSq3FnPmElaWBQ.text: Sorry to see all the hate going on but I tell ya, for breakfast, Giraffe is 1 tasty spot! Looking for something to lead us into an adventurous day at Spitalfields Market, Giraffe was the ultimate in proximity & my friend highly recommended Pancakes were the star of the morning & boy were they tasty. Smallish hotcakes whimsically stacked with banana pillars & blueberries throughout.....felt like a kid when our plates arrived. Just a bit doughy but not too dry - just how I like it.  Soaked up the lovely syrup & paired well w/ the fresh fruit. Also enjoyed the Sunrise Smoothie w/ OJ, nanners & strawberries.... & their stirrers are long, plastic Giraffes! Love it Add a Double Shot Latte & we're ready to brave the crowds!

-ebZpZ4uE5xb6tqPJjV3sQ.text: Family friendly restaurant serving mainly simple food, cooked well at very reasonable prices. Says it all really. The all day brunch is fab, the burgers are tasty and the stir fried duck is still yummy.

u6cQyWjnd_XqsfhQLB7wHg.text: I'm torn about this place and have mixed feelings.I've been here a number of times and half of them have been great, the food has been good, and the other half of the time there has been something wrong with the food, or it's taken a long time to be served.I usually only visit Giraffe with visiting friends as they have such a varied menu, but with lots of other restaurants in the area, I'd suggest visiting these if you want consistently good food and a cheaper option.

FYRsSWT-ttt-U1rHeMHB1A.text: Great place, great food, great service... Me and some friends went in January 2015,we decided to try somewhere different to our normal places to eat. Definitely happy we branched out, food was served quickly and we ordered the Irish coffee and butterscotch martini afterwards, some of the best we've had! Worth going for lunch or dinner :)

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Three plates consisting of sushi salad, bbq duck tacos, chicken asian noodle salad.. All worth trying :)
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

Xvd7_aNQIjY6nc4L1APOOA.text: I was a bit dubious on going to Giraffe but I was pleasantly surprised when I ate there the other week. The menu was fairly varied but I had my heart set on the steak and chips. It was fairly pricey compared to other venues serving the same food but the quality of the meat and the service made up for it.I would definitely eat at a Giraffe restaurant again.

P1YldvZWIpeahHlSzX8gWg.text: Cool and casual spot in Spitalfields.  I got the vegetarian burrito, and it was super fresh and delicious!  I also got the Strawberry-lime cider (also super delish, I recommend this if you're into ciders) they served it over ice and mint.  For those who think this is "American cuisine" it certainly is not!  (Trust me, I'm American)  It's more like a modern fusion of food from around the world. The waitress was also super sweet, which made my dining experience a whole lot better.I can't wait to go back here and take my friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Vegetarian Burrito with Strawberry-Lime cider

8NQ4gGjjzC_j3Vqx4Mjimw.text: Convenient, really pleasant staff, relaxed place to eat.It's suitable if you just want to drop in somewhere you know you'll get a warm welcome and consistently good food, and usually served quickly.  The menu is varied enough that you can usually find something to please everyone.The only slight drawback is the value for money...I think they are a bit overpriced.  £2.65 for a few pieces of sourdough toast... really? A better offering would be to charge £1 extra on the omelettes and throw in some toast on the side.  On the positive end, they serve teapigs tea which is just divine, and brought to you in lovely little cast iron pots. Stop, have a drink and watch the Spitalfields market life go by.
